concept.title: Local indexer recovery
concept.shortdesc: The process associated with the local indexer recovery.

conbody.p: The local indexer recovery occurs under the following circumstances:

ul.li: When the indexer needs to roll back data due to KV data loss.

ol.li: Sets status to recovery mode and continues to listen to messages and put new mutations into the mutation queue.
Notifies the index manager that it is in recovery mode.
If the index coordinator is in rollback mode, cleans up its state.
Opens a catch-up connection with each projector and DCP using the proposed restart timestamp.
Attempts to restore to a snapshot based on the DCP restart timestamp and the new failover timestamp. These timestamps are returned from the projector.
If the local indexer has indexes that are being backfilled (index loading), the local indexer opens a new connection with the projector for the backfill traffic.
At any time during recovery, the local indexer listens to the index coordinator message regarding new rollback (for example, key-value failover when the local indexer is in recovery).

Given the snapshot timestamp, the local indexer asks the index coordinator all the known stability timestamps that are greater than the indexerâ€™s snapshot timestamp. The mutations in the catch-up queue are persisted according to these set of timestamps.
The local indexer starts listening to any mutation coming from the main UPR pipe (from the projector). Any new mutations are held in the mutation queue of the local indexer.

Upon receiving catch-up mutations, the local indexer puts them into a catch-up queue and maintains a catch-up timestamp to tell the version at the tip of the catch-up queue. The catch-up timestamp is updated whenever a mutation is put onto the catch-up queue.

Whenever the local indexer sees the the catch-up timestamp matches the a previous stability timestamp (from the index coordinator), the local indexer writes those mutations to the storage. The local indexer creates snapshots as necessary.

For each vbucket, once the local indexer sees that largest sequence number in the catch-up queue is equal to the smallest sequence number in the mutation queue, the local indexer sends a message to the projector to terminate the DCP connection for that vBucket.
Once all the DCP connections are terminated, the local indexer starts processing the mutation queue.
Once the local indexer catches up with the latest stability timestamp, its status is set to normal mode.

conbody.note: If the local indexer dies during recovery, the sequence is re-executed upon restart.
